job.title: Data Modeler
job.description: <p><strong>Description:</strong></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>The EBDM Model Developer/ Analyst will function as part of the EBDM Model Development team. The role will primarily facilitate ongoing model validation efforts including, but not limited to: writing and executing model code; training, testing and validation of model performance against benchmark methods; data quality assessment; implementation of data preprocessing methods; reproducible workflow design; and documentation of methods, assumptions and outcomes. Analytical focus will provide insights into business processes, derived from model applications and involve communication of technical procedures to a wide audience with varying backgrounds.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Required Job Skills:</p><p>• Proficiency in Python programming and object oriented design</p><p>• Practical experience with large data analysis with multiple open source programming libraries (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, scipy, statsmodels, as well as one of tensorflow/keras/pytorch)</p><p>• Hadoop, Apache Spark</p><p>• Neo4j and Cypher</p><p>• General statistics and probability</p><p>• Time series analysis, forecasting and anomaly detection</p><p>• Graph analytics/ network science</p><p>• Hands on advanced statistical modeling and/or machine learning model development in Python</p><p>• Experience with model design, implementation and evaluation of model performance</p><p>• Model validation procedures with knowledge of regulatory requirements in industry</p><p>• Quick learner with capacity for independent judgment and decision making</p><p>• Advanced Excel</p><p><br></p><p>Desired Job Skills:</p><p><br></p><p>• Effective written and oral communication skills, especially in reference to explaining quantitative methodology for audiences of all technical backgrounds</p><p>• Degree in quantitative discipline involving computer science, engineering or statistics</p><p>• Jira/Agile</p><p>• PowerPoint</p><ul><li>• SharePoint</li></ul>
